events.message: The claimant reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th at a city intersection, resulting in moderate damage to the front bumper and headlight.
After initial review, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the presence of keywords like car and collision in the incident report.
An insurance agent specializing in vehicle accidents was assigned to handle the case promptly and ensure detailed investigation and customer support.
The claimant received formal acknowledgment of their car accident claim via email, confirming our commitment to timely processing.
Request was sent to the claimant for submission of a police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a repair estimate from an authorized garage.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including the police report, photographic evidence of the accident, and an official repair quote.
Our investigation team began evaluating the submitted files and gathering statements from involved parties to assess liability and damage extent.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and vehicle damage estimates are consistent with the reported collision.
A settlement proposal covering full repair costs and a rental vehicle reimbursement was sent to the claimant for approval consideration.
The claimant responded expressing satisfaction with the settlement offer and appreciated the clear communication throughout the process.
Official approval was granted internally to release payment and close the claim, based on investigation and customer confirmation.
Payment for vehicle repairs and rental reimbursement was disbursed to the claimant’s account as part of the claims settlement procedure.
The insurance claim was formally closed after payment issuance and final confirmation from the claimant regarding claim satisfaction.
All case files and documentation were archived in the company’s secure system to ensure compliance with data retention policies.
